title: Utsuwa Key
subtitle: うつわ ✦ Utsuwa comes from the Japanese word for 'vessel', symbolizing a container for your digital soul
description: うつわ ✦ A contactless FIDO-2 passkey storing device!

content.heading: Another Security Key
content.text:
A FIDO-2 Hardware passkey storing device that revolutionizes authentication with contactless technology. Unlike standard keys that use mechanical buttons (or exposed copper), **Utsuwa** employs __**Hall Effect Sensors**__, to enable secure authentication via magnetic rings or charms - eliminating physical contact and reducing wear.

Built on the RP2354A microcontroller and open-source firmware, Utsuwa features custom PCB artwork, designed on Figma, by me. This device stores FIDO-2 passkeys securely while maintaining a sleek, modern form factor and unique design.

content.heading: Features
list: Hall Effect sensor for contactless authentication.

content.heading: Open Source
content.text: Utsuwa is completely open-source, available on my GitHub.
